name: CorporacciÃ³nCan - Grupo Corporativo Empresarial Caja Navara
overview: CorporacciÑƒnCan - Grupo Corporativo Empresarial Caja Navara is the private equity and venture capital arm of Caja de Ahorros and Monte de Piedad de Navarra. The firm specializes in venture capital and private equity financing in medium-sized or large companies. In venture capital, the firm seeks to invest in seed capital. It seeks to invest in companies with growth potential which are immersed in new projects; seeking a change in strategic direction owing to change in or professionalization of senior management; intent on a new project via their takeover by the management team or management buyout; or companies looking for a financial partner to develop their full potentiality on capital markets. The firm makes investments in food product and agriculture, financial sector, energy, leisure and tourism, environment, specialist industry, distribution and logistics, industrial, real estate, research and biotechnology and biomedicine, engineering and consultancy, media and communication, services, welfare and healthcare services, telecommunications, and infrastructure sectors. It targets investments in Spain. The firm also invests through participative loans, via subholdings, creation of specific vehicles for investment, exchange of shares with other entities, and co-investments. CorporacciÑƒnCan - Grupo Corporativo Empresarial Caja Navara was established in May 2000 and is headquartered in Pamplona, Spain.
